1â†’{
     2â†’  "feature": "Unified Daily Dashboard",
     3â†’  "description": "# Unified Daily Dashboard

Central dashboard showing all daily health metrics: calorie balance (intake vs. TDEE), macro breakdown, exercise summary, sleep quality, and body composition status. Pre-calculated values for fast loading.

## Rationale
Key differentiator: all-in-one view that competitors don't provide. Users currently need 3-4 apps. Pre-calculated DailyLog entity ensures sub-0.5s performance, directly addressing MyFitnessPal's lag complaints and Lose It's freezing issues. Clean SwiftUI native interface unlike InBody's clunky app.

## User Stories
- As a user, I want one screen showing all my health data so that I have a complete picture
- As a busy person, I want fast app loading so that tracking doesn't waste my time

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Dashboard loads in under 0.5 seconds with pre-calculated values
- [ ] Shows today's calorie intake vs. TDEE with visual indicator
- [ ] Displays macro breakdown (protein/carbs/fat) with progress bars
- [ ] Shows exercise calories burned for the day
- [ ] Displays previous night's sleep duration and quality
- [ ] Quick-add buttons for food, exercise, and body composition
- [ ] Date navigation to view past days
- [ ] Pull-to-refresh updates all metrics
",

entries.content:
I've created a comprehensive implementation plan for the **Unified Daily Dashboard** feature. Here's a summary:

## Implementation Plan Created

### ğŸ“‹ 6 Phases with 17 Subtasks

| Phase | Name | Subtasks | Est. Hours |
|-------|------|----------|------------|
| 1 | Core ViewModel & Data Layer | 3 | 4.5h |
| 2 | Dashboard UI Components | 5 | 8.5h |
| 3 | Date Navigation & Quick Actions | 2 | 2.5h |
| 4 | Dashboard Integration | 4 | 4h |
| 5 | Empty States & Polish | 3 | 3.5h |
| 6 | Testing & Documentation | 2 | 3h |

**Total Estimated: ~25 hours**

### ğŸ¯ Key Components

1. **DashboardViewModel** - Manages DailyLog data, date navigation, loading states
2. **CalorieBalanceCard** - Circular progress showing intake vs TDEE
3. **MacroBreakdownCard** - Progress bars for protein/carbs/fat
4. **ExerciseSummaryCard** - Calories burned, exercise count, minutes
5. **SleepQualityCard** - Duration with emoji indicator (ğŸ”µ/ğŸŸ¢/ğŸŸ¡/ğŸ”´/ğŸŸ )
6. **BodyCompositionCard** - Today's weight and body fat %
7. **DateNavigationHeader** - Navigate past days
8. **QuickAddButtons** - Fast access to food, exercise, body entry

### âœ… Acceptance Criteria Mapped
All 8 acceptance criteria from the spec are mapped to specific subtasks.

### ğŸ“ Key Technical Decisions
- **DailyLog** entity already has all pre-calculated values â†’ Fast loading (<0.5s)
- Follow existing Clean Architecture pattern
- Reuse existing `SleepStatus` enum and navigation callback patterns

The plan is saved to:
- `.auto-claude/specs/010-unified-daily-dashboard/implementation_plan.json`
- `.auto-claude/specs/010-unified-daily-dashboard/build-progress.txt`
I'll help you implement subtask 1.1: adding the `fetchCurrentDay` method to DailyLogRepository. Let me start by understanding the codebase structure and requirements.

entries.detail: [{'type': 'text', 'text': '## Codebase Discoveries\n- `Bodii/Domain/Entities/DailyLog.swift`: DailyLog entity already contains all pre-calculated dashboard data: totalCaloriesIn, tdee, netCalories, macros (carbsRatio, proteinRatio, fatRatio), exercise stats (totalCaloriesOut, exerciseMinutes, exerciseCount), sleep data (sleepDuration, sleepStatus), and body composition (weight, bodyFatPct). No runtime calculation needed for dashboard.\n- `Bodii/Presentation/Features/Dashboard/DashboardView.swift`: Existing DashboardView has placeholder cards for diet, exercise, and sleep. Uses MetabolismViewModel for BMR/TDEE. Has pull-to-refresh and date formatting helpers already implemented. Navigation callback pattern (onNavigateToBody) already established.'}]

entries.content:
Perfect! I've successfully completed **Subtask 1.1: Extend DailyLogRepository for Dashboard**.

## Summary of Changes

I added the `fetchCurrentDay` method across all three layers of the Clean Architecture pattern:

### 1. **Protocol Layer** (`Domain/Interfaces/DailyLogRepository.swift`)
   - Added `fetchCurrentDay(userId:)` method to the protocol
   - Method signature returns `DailyLog?` for the current day

### 2. **Repository Implementation** (`Data/Repositories/DailyLogRepositoryImpl.swift`)
   - Implemented `fetchCurrentDay(userId:)` by delegating to the local data source
   - Follows the existing pattern of passing through to the data layer

### 3. **Data Source Layer** (`Data/DataSources/Local/DailyLogLocalDataSource.swift`)
   - Implemented `fetchCurrentDay(userId:)` by calling the existing `fetch(for:userId:)` method with today's date
   - The date normalization to startOfDay is handled automatically by the existing `fetchDailyLog` helper

## Key Features

âœ… **Single Source of Truth**: The method provides a dedicated entry point for dashboard data access  
âœ… **Pre-calculated Values**: Returns DailyLog with all pre-calculated values (calories, macros, exercise, sleep, body composition)  
âœ… **Clean Architecture**: Follows the existing pattern with proper separation of concerns  
âœ… **Performance**: Leverages existing optimized Core Data queries with proper date normalization  

## Commit

```
auto-claude: 1.1 - Add fetchCurrentDay method to DailyLogRepository
```

The implementation is now ready for **Subtask 1.2** (Create DashboardViewModel), which will use this method to fetch dashboard data.
I'll help you implement subtask 1.2: Create DashboardViewModel with @Published properties. Let me start by reading the relevant files to understand the context and patterns.

## âœ… Subtask 1.2 Completed Successfully!

I've successfully implemented the **DashboardViewModel** with all required functionality. Here's what was created:

### ğŸ“‹ Implementation Summary

**File Created:**
- `Bodii/Presentation/Features/Dashboard/DashboardViewModel.swift` (504 lines)

### ğŸ¯ Key Features Implemented

#### 1. **@Observable Pattern (iOS 17+)**
   - Modern SwiftUI approach (follows `ExerciseListViewModel` pattern)
   - Auto-observes all properties without `@Published` annotations
   - Better performance with granular updates

#### 2. **Core Properties**
   - `selectedDate: Date` - Current date being viewed
   - `dailyLog: DailyLog?` - Daily log data with all pre-calculated values
   - `isLoading: Bool` - Loading state for UI feedback
   - `errorMessage: String?` - Error handling and display

#### 3. **Computed Properties** (for easy access)
   - Calorie data: `totalCaloriesIn`, `tdee`, `netCalories`
   - Macros: `totalCarbs`, `totalProtein`, `totalFat`, `carbsRatio`, `proteinRatio`, `fatRatio`
   - Exercise: `totalCaloriesOut`, `exerciseMinutes`, `exerciseCount`
   - Sleep: `sleepDuration`, `sleepStatus`
   - Body: `weight`, `bodyFatPct`

#### 4. **Required Methods**
   - âœ… `loadDailyLog(for:)` - Loads DailyLog for specific date
   - âœ… `refresh()` - Refreshes current date's data (for pull-to-refresh)
   - âœ… `navigateDate(by:)` - Navigate by N days (positive or negative)

#### 5. **Bonus Helper Methods**
   - `goToPreviousDay()` - Navigate to previous day
   - `goToNextDay()` - Navigate to next day
   - `goToToday()` - Return to today
   - `selectDate(_:)` - Jump to specific date
   - `onAppear()` - Initial load when view appears
   - `clearError()` - Clear error messages
   - `formattedSelectedDate` - Korean localized date formatting ("ì˜¤ëŠ˜", "ì–´ì œ", or full date)

#### 6. **State Management**
   - `isEmpty: Bool` - Check if data exists
   - `hasError: Bool` - Check if error exists
   - `isToday: Bool` - Check if viewing today
   - `isFuture: Bool` - Check if viewing future date

### ğŸ—ï¸ Architecture Compliance

- âœ… Follows **Clean Architecture** patterns
- âœ… Uses **Dependency Injection** via constructor
- âœ… **Protocol-oriented** (depends on `DailyLogRepository` protocol)
- âœ… **@MainActor** for UI thread safety
- âœ… **async/await** for modern concurrency
- âœ… Comprehensive **documentation** with learning notes
- âœ… **Korean localization** for date formatting

### ğŸ“Š Performance Focus

The ViewModel leverages **pre-calculated values** from `DailyLog`:
- No runtime calculations needed
- All aggregated data ready to display
- Supports **<0.5s loading** performance target

### ğŸ”„ Git Commits

1. **e31b3da** - Main implementation of DashboardViewModel
2. **e27c081** - Updated progress tracking files

### âœ… Quality Checklist

- âœ… Follows patterns from reference files (`ExerciseListViewModel`)
- âœ… No debug statements (no print/console.log)
- âœ… Error handling in place
- âœ… Clean commit with descriptive message
- âœ… Implementation plan updated to "completed"

Perfect! Let me create a summary of what was accomplished:

## âœ… Subtask 1.3 Completed Successfully

### Changes Made:

1. **Added DailyLog Data Source** (Lines 58-64)
   - Created `dailyLogLocalDataSource` lazy var
   - Injects `PersistenceController.shared.viewContext` for Core Data operations
   - Follows existing pattern from `bodyLocalDataSource`

2. **Added DailyLog Repository** (Lines 82-89)
   - Created `dailyLogRepository` lazy var
   - Uses `DailyLogRepositoryImpl` implementation
   - Injects `dailyLogLocalDataSource` dependency
   - Provides interface for DashboardViewModel to fetch pre-calculated daily data

3. **Added DashboardViewModel Factory Method** (Lines 194-208)
   - Created `makeDashboardViewModel(userId:)` in Factory Methods section
   - Injects `dailyLogRepository` and `userId` dependencies
   - Follows Factory Method Pattern used by other ViewModels
   - Includes comprehensive documentation with Korean comments and Java comparisons

### Dependency Injection Chain:
```
PersistenceController.shared.viewContext
    â†“
DailyLogLocalDataSource
    â†“
DailyLogRepositoryImpl (implements DailyLogRepository)
    â†“
DashboardViewModel
```

### Code Quality:
âœ… Follows existing patterns exactly
âœ… Lazy initialization for efficient resource usage
âœ… Educational Korean comments with Java comparisons
âœ… Proper separation of concerns (Data Sources â†’ Repositories â†’ ViewModels)
âœ… Clean commit with descriptive message
